com.fortify.processrunner.processor

Class AbstractProcessorGroupByExpressions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.processrunner.processor.AbstractProcessor
      • com.fortify.processrunner.processor.AbstractProcessorGroupByExpressions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICLIOptionDefinitionProvider, IProcessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractProcessorBuildObjectMapFromGroupedObjects, AbstractProcessorBuildObjectMapsFromGroupedObjects

    public abstract class AbstractProcessorGroupByExpressions
extends AbstractProcessor

    This IProcessor implementation allows for collecting and grouping data stored in the Context during the Phase#PROCESS phase. The rootExpression property defines the expression used to retrieve each root object from the Context. The optional groupTemplateExpression is evaluated on each root object to identify the group that this root object belongs to.

    During the Phase#POST_PROCESS phase, the processGroup(Context, String, List) method will be called to allow actual implementations to process each group.

    If no grouping expression has been defined, or if the DisableGrouping context property has been set to true, the processGroup(Context, String, List) method will be invoked immediately for every individual root object.

    Author:
    Ruud Senden

      • process

        protected final boolean process(Context context)

        This method retrieves the current root object by evaluating the expression configured through setRootExpression(SimpleExpression) on the given Context.

        If grouping is enabled, the group key will then be determined by evaluating the expression configured through setGroupTemplateExpression(TemplateExpression) on the root object, and the root object will be stored in the temporary cache based on the group key. The grouped objects will be further processed by the postProcess(Context) method once all objects have been grouped.

        If grouping is not enabled, the processGroup(Context, String, List) method will be called directly in order to immediately process the single root object.

        Overrides:
        process in class AbstractProcessor
        Returns:

      • postProcess

        protected final boolean postProcess(Context context)
        If grouping is enabled, this method will get each group of objects from the group cache, and call the processGroup(Context, String, List) method for each group of objects. If grouping is not enabled, the processGroup(Context, String, List) method will already have been called by the process(Context) method and thus will not be called again. Once finished, the temporary cache will be cleaned up.
        Overrides:
        postProcess in class AbstractProcessor
        Returns:

      • processGroup

        protected abstract boolean processGroup(Context context,
                                        String groupName,
                                        List<Object> currentGroup)
        Subclasses must implement this method to actually process an individual group. Note that groupName may be null if grouping is disabled; in that case currentGroup will contain only a single object.
        Parameters:

      • addGroupEntry

        protected void addGroupEntry(Context context,
                             String key,
                             Object value)
        Add a new group entry. This will dynamically add the group entry to the groups map if it does not yet exist. Depending on the disk-backed map implementation, updated values may not be stored, so we explicitly create a new value list and overwrite the existing map entry.
        Parameters:
        context -
        key -
        value -
